result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Jury Trial.

On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and READ IN to case 20CM2232 and case 22CM1967.

Defendant Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 10/10/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Expires: 11/8/22

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo not in court, in custody.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring. GPS OVERRIDE for victim and community safety.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $2,500.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  24 hour curfew with the exception of verified employment, court and legal appointments.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No contact order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KR-M (2/14/1978); FG (4/19/1987); 2525 S. 14th St. Milwaukee, WI

Defendant Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo not in court.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on7/26/22 @ 2p
